Package com.glyart.mystral.database

Class Database

java.lang.Object
com.glyart.mystral.database.DatabaseAccessor
com.glyart.mystral.database.Database
All Implemented Interfaces:
DataSourceSupplier, DataOperations, Supplier<DataSource>
public class Database extends DatabaseAccessor implements DataOperations, DataSourceSupplier
Represents implementation of basic synchronous operations for interacting with a data source.

An instance of this class is available by passing a valid DataSource.

This class:

  • works on the same thread that invokes its methods
  • executes all the CRUD operations on a data source
  • handles exceptions and communicates the sql that generated the problem (if possible)
  • gives nullable results
  • iterates over ResultSets
  • deals with static and prepared statements

Methods of this class use various callback interfaces. A reading of those is greatly suggested.
Since the callback interfaces make Database's methods parameterizable, there should be no need to subclass this class.

See Also:
BatchSetter, ParametrizedBatchSetter, PreparedStatementFunction, PreparedStatementCreator, ResultSetExtractor, ResultSetRowMapper, StatementFunction

    • update

      public int update​(@NotNull @NotNull PreparedStatementCreator creator, @Nullable @Nullable PreparedStatementSetter setter, boolean getGeneratedKey) throws DataAccessException
      Description copied from interface: DataOperations
      Performs a single update operation (like insert, delete, update) using a PreparedStatementCreator to provide SQL and any required parameters. A PreparedStatementSetter can be passed as helper that sets bind parameters.
      Specified by:
      update in interface DataOperations
      Parameters:
      creator - a callback that provides the PreparedStatement with bind parameters
      setter - a helper that sets bind parameters. If it's null then this will be an update with static SQL
      getGeneratedKey - a boolean value
      Returns:
      the number of the affected rows (or -1 if there is any problem) If getGeneratedKeys is true, this method will return the key of the new generated row
      Throws:
      DataAccessException - if there is any problem

      sql - the SQL containing bind parameters
      params - arguments to be bind to the given SQL

    • batchUpdate

      public void batchUpdate​(@NotNull @NotNull String sql, @NotNull @NotNull BatchSetter batchSetter) throws IllegalStateException
      Description copied from interface: DataOperations
      Performs multiple update operations using a single SQL statement.

      NOTE: this method will be unusable if the driver doesn't support batch updates.

      Specified by:
      batchUpdate in interface DataOperations
      Parameters:
      sql - the SQL containing bind parameters. It will be reused because all statements in a batch use the same SQL
      batchSetter - a callback that sets parameters on the PreparedStatement created by this method
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the driver doesn't support batch updates

    • batchUpdate

      public void batchUpdate​(@NotNull @NotNull String sql, @Nullable @Nullable List<Object[]> batchArgs, int... sqlTypes) throws IllegalStateException
      Description copied from interface: DataOperations
      Performs multiple update operations using a single SQL statement.
      Specified by:
      batchUpdate in interface DataOperations
      Parameters:
      sql - The SQL containing bind parameters. It will be reused because all statements in a batch use the same SQL
      batchArgs - A list of object arrays containing the batch arguments
      sqlTypes - an integer array containing the type of the query's parameters, expressed as Types
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the driver doesn't support batch updates

    • query

      public <T> T query​(@NotNull @NotNull PreparedStatementCreator creator, @Nullable @Nullable PreparedStatementSetter setter, @NotNull @NotNull ResultSetExtractor<T> extractor) throws DataAccessException
      Description copied from interface: DataOperations
      Executes a query using a PreparedStatement, created by a PreparedStatementCreator and with his values set by a PreparedStatementSetter.

      Most other query methods use this method, but application code will always work with either a creator or a setter.

      Specified by:
      query in interface DataOperations
      Type Parameters:
      T - the result type
      Parameters:
      creator - a callback that creates a PreparedStatement
      setter - a callback that sets values on the PreparedStatement. If null, the SQL will be treated as static SQL with no bind parameters
      extractor - a callback that will extract results given a ResultSet
      Returns:
      a result object (if it exists), according to the ResultSetExtractor implementation
      Throws:
      DataAccessException - if there is any problem
      See Also:
      PreparedStatementSetter

      Description copied from interface: DataOperations
      Executes a query given an SQL statement: it will be used to create a PreparedStatement. Then a list of arguments will be bound to the query. The ResultSetExtractor implementation will read the ResultSet.

      DataAccessException - if there is any problem

      Description copied from interface: DataOperations
      Executes a query given an SQL statement: it will be used to create a PreparedStatement. Then a list of arguments with their sql Types will be bound to the query. The ResultSetExtractor implementation will read the ResultSet.

    • queryOrElseGet

      public <T> T queryOrElseGet​(@NotNull @NotNull String sql, @Nullable @Nullable Object[] args, @NotNull @NotNull ResultSetExtractor<T> extractor, Supplier<T> supplier, int... sqlTypes) throws DataAccessException
      Description copied from interface: DataOperations
      Executes a query given an SQL statement: it will be used to create a PreparedStatement. Then a list of arguments with their sql Types will be bound to the query. The ResultSetExtractor implementation will read the ResultSet.

      If a null result is returned, then the given supplier will be invoked, supplying the specified result (it can be null).

      Specified by:
      queryOrElseGet in interface DataOperations
      Type Parameters:
      T - the result type
      Parameters:
      sql - the query to execute
      args - arguments to bind to the query
      extractor - a callback that will extract results given a ResultSet
      supplier - the supplier of another result
      sqlTypes - an integer array containing the type of the query's parameters, expressed as Types
      Returns:
      a result object (if it exists), according to the ResultSetExtractor implementation, otherwise the result of the supplier invocation
      Throws:
      DataAccessException - if there is any problem
      See Also:
      Types

    • queryForObject

      public <T> T queryForObject​(@NotNull @NotNull String sql, Object[] args, @NotNull @NotNull ResultSetRowMapper<T> resultSetRowMapper) throws DataAccessException, IncorrectDataSizeException
      Description copied from interface: DataOperations
      Executes a query given an SQL statement: it will be used to create a PreparedStatement. Then a list of arguments will be bound to the query.

      The first ResultSet row will be mapped to a result object using the ResultSetRowMapper implementation.

      The ResultSet must have exactly ONE row.
      Specified by:
      queryForObject in interface DataOperations
      Type Parameters:
      T - the result type
      Parameters:
      sql - the query to execute
      args - arguments to bind to the query
      resultSetRowMapper - a callback that will map one object per ResultSet row
      Returns:
      a mapped result object (if it exists)
      Throws:
      DataAccessException - if there is any problem
      IncorrectDataSizeException - if the query doesn't return exactly one result

    • queryForObjectOrElseGet

      @Nullable public <T> T queryForObjectOrElseGet​(@NotNull @NotNull String sql, Object[] args, ResultSetRowMapper<T> resultSetRowMapper, @NotNull @NotNull Supplier<T> supplier, int... sqlTypes) throws DataAccessException, IncorrectDataSizeException
      Description copied from interface: DataOperations
      Executes a query given an SQL statement: it will be used to create a PreparedStatement. Then a list of arguments with their sql Types will be bound to the query.

      The first ResultSet row will be mapped to a result object using the ResultSetRowMapper implementation.

      The ResultSet mustn't have more than ONE row.

      If a null result is returned, then the given supplier will be invoked, supplying the specified result (it can be null).

      Specified by:
      queryForObjectOrElseGet in interface DataOperations
      Type Parameters:
      T - the result type
      Parameters:
      sql - the query to execute
      args - arguments to bind to the query
      resultSetRowMapper - a callback that will map one object per ResultSet row
      supplier - the supplier of another result
      sqlTypes - an integer array containing the type of the query's parameters, expressed as Types
      Returns:
      a mapped result object (if it exists), otherwise the result of the supplier invocation
      Throws:
      DataAccessException - if there is any problem
      IncorrectDataSizeException - if the query return more than one result
      See Also:
